chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
m: nat
P: nat -> Type

Goal:
(forall n : nat, n < m -> P n + (P n -> False)) -> {n : nat & ((n < m) * P n)%type} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> P n -> False}

Premises:
Record type : Type := Check { result : bool; test : ssreflect.NonPropType.test_of result; frame : ssreflect.NonPropType.call_of (ssreflect.NonPropType.condition test) result } Arguments ssreflect.NonPropType.Check [result]%bool_scope [test]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive False : Prop := 
le_lt_eq_dec : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> {n < m} + {n = m}
le_lt_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> n < S m
le_not_lt : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> ~ m < n
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
nat_rec : forall P : nat -> Set, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
lt_eq_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n < m} + {n = m} + {m < n}
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_lt : forall n m : nat, n < m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
gt_le_S : forall n m : nat, m > n -> S n <= m
le_n_S : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> S n <= S m
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
BinNat.N.binary_rec : forall P : BinNums.N -> Set, P BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, P n -> P (BinNat.N.double n)) -> (forall n : BinNums.N, P n -> P (BinNat.N.succ_double n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, P n
Nat.lt_0_succ : forall n : nat, 0 < S n
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Fin.t (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
ZArith_dec.not_Zeq_inf : forall n m : BinNums.Z, n <> m -> {BinInt.Z.lt n m} + {BinInt.Z.lt m n}
Fin.of_nat : forall p n : nat, Fin.t n + {exists m : nat, p = n + m}
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
BinInt.Z.ge_le : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.ge n m -> BinInt.Z.le m n
BinInt.Z.lt_gt : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m -> BinInt.Z.gt m n
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_le : forall n m : nat, n <= m < -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
gt_eq_gt_dec : forall n m : nat, {m > n} + {n = m} + {n > m}
nat_compare_alt = fun n m : nat => match lt_eq_lt_dec n m with | inleft (left _) => Lt | inleft (right _) => Eq | inright _ => Gt end : nat -> nat -> comparison Arguments nat_compare_alt (_ _)%nat_scope
O_or_S : forall n : nat, {m : nat | S m = n} + {0 = n}
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
Zorder.Ztrichotomy_inf : forall n m : BinNums.Z, {BinInt.Z.lt n m} + {n = m} + {BinInt.Z.gt n m}
ZArith_dec.Z_dec : forall n m : BinNums.Z, {BinInt.Z.lt n m} + {BinInt.Z.gt n m} + {n = m}
ZArith_dec.Z_dec' : forall n m : BinNums.Z, {BinInt.Z.lt n m} + {BinInt.Z.lt m n} + {n = m}
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m < -> n = m
measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope

```coq
unfold -.
destruct H as [H | H].
* exists (projT1 H).
  split.
  ++ apply le_lt_eq_dec in H as [[|] | ]; try discriminate.
     -- apply le_not_lt in H.
        eapply le_lt_n_Sm; eauto.
  ++ apply P; auto.
* destruct H as [H | H].
  * exists (projT1 H).
    split.
    ++ apply le_lt_eq_dec in H as [[|] | ]; try discriminate.
       -- apply le_not_lt in H.
          eapply le_lt_n_Sm; eauto.
    ++ apply P; auto.
  * apply forall_intro.
    intros n H.
    apply IHn; auto.
Qed.```
